dance.name: Kuchipudi
dance.description: A graceful classical dance form that originated in the village of Kuchipudi. Known for its dramatic elements, rhythmic footwork, and unique Tarangam performance on a brass plate.

dance.name: Bardo Chham
dance.description: A masked dance performed by the Monpa tribe, depicting the victory of good over evil through elaborate costumes and symbolic movements.

dance.name: Bihu
dance.description: An energetic dance performed during the Bihu festival, characterized by brisk hip movements and rapid hand gestures, celebrating harvest and springtime.

dance.name: Bidesia
dance.description: A folk theater-dance form that portrays the story of migrant workers and their separation from loved ones, combining elements of dance, drama, and music.

dance.name: Panthi
dance.description: A spiritual dance form of the Satnami community, combining devotional songs with synchronized dance movements.

dance.name: Fugdi
dance.description: A fast-paced traditional dance performed by women during Hindu festivals, especially Ganesh Chaturthi.

dance.name: Garba
dance.description: A traditional dance performed during Navratri, featuring circular movements around a central lamp or idol of Goddess Durga.

dance.name: Phag
dance.description: A traditional dance performed during the Holi festival, celebrating the arrival of spring with vibrant movements.

dance.name: Nati
dance.description: A traditional dance of the Kullu valley, performed during festivals and social gatherings with rhythmic movements.

dance.name: Chhau
dance.description: A semi-classical Indian dance with martial art movements, performed with elaborate masks and vigorous movements.

dance.name: Yakshagana
dance.description: A traditional theater-dance form combining dance, music, dialogue, costume, make-up, and stage techniques.

dance.name: Kathakali
dance.description: A major form of classical Indian dance-drama, known for its colorful make-up, elaborate costumes and face masks.

dance.name: Jawara
dance.description: A harvest dance celebrating the sowing season and spring, performed with traditional instruments.

dance.name: Lavani
dance.description: A traditional dance form known for its powerful rhythm and expressive performances, performed to the beat of the Dholki.

dance.name: Manipuri
dance.description: A classical Indian dance characterized by gentle movements and religious themes, particularly focused on Radha-Krishna.

dance.name: Ka Shad Mastieh
dance.description: A traditional religious dance of the Khasi tribe performed during festivals and ceremonies.

dance.name: Cheraw
dance.description: A bamboo dance requiring great skill and coordination, performed with dancers moving between rhythmically clapping bamboo poles.

dance.name: War Dance
dance.description: A traditional dance depicting warfare and victory celebrations of various Naga tribes.

dance.name: Odissi
dance.description: One of the oldest surviving dance forms of India, known for its sculpturesque poses and fluid movements.

dance.name: Bhangra
dance.description: An energetic harvest dance traditionally performed by farmers to celebrate the coming of spring.

dance.name: Ghoomar
dance.description: A traditional women's dance performed on special occasions, featuring graceful pirouetting while moving in and out of a circle.

dance.name: Singhi Chham
dance.description: A masked dance depicting the snow lion of Tibet, performed during Buddhist festivals.

dance.name: Bharatanatyam
dance.description: One of the most popular classical Indian dances, known for its grace, purity, tenderness, and sculpturesque poses.

dance.name: Perini Shivatandavam
dance.description: An ancient dance form performed by male dancers, originally performed by warriors before going into battle.

dance.name: Hojagiri
dance.description: A folk dance performed by women balancing bottles on their heads while dancing on earthen pitchers.

dance.name: Kathak
dance.description: A major classical dance form known for its rhythmic footwork, spins, and expressive storytelling.

dance.name: Chaupai
dance.description: A traditional dance form performed during religious and social occasions in the Kumaon region.

dance.name: Gaudiya Nritya
dance.description: A classical dance form that evolved from the traditional dance forms of Bengal, depicting stories of Radha-Krishna.
